itp 0.1.0
  • Reference

Households data

Source: R/data.R
households.Rd

Household data from the ECV for the years 2005, 2011, and 2019.

households

Format

A tibble (see tibble::tibble-package) with columns:

id_hh

Household identifier.

ecv_year

The year the survey was conducted. Data refer to the previous year.

region

Autonomous Community indicator. Values:

ANDAndalucía
ARAAragón
ASTAsturias
BALBaleares
CNRCanarias
CNTCantabria
CYLCastilla y León
CLMCastilla La Mancha
CATCataluña
VALValencia
EXTExtremadura
GALGalicia
MADMadrid
MURMurcia
NAVNavarra
PVAPaís Vasco
RIOLa Rioja
CEUCeuta
MELMelilla

cluster

Primary sampling unit indicator.

weight_hh

Household population weight.

urb

Degree of urbanisation. Factor levels: 'Low', 'Med', and 'High'.

size_hh

Number of persons per household

type_hh

Household type. Factor levels:

HH_01One member: a man aged less than 30.
HH_02One member: a man aged between 30 and 64.
HH_03One member: a man aged 65 or more.
HH_04One member: a woman aged less than 30.
HH_05One member: a woman aged between 30 and 64.
HH_06One member: a woman aged 65 or more.
HH_07Two adults without dependent children and at least one person aged 65 or more.
HH_08Two adults without dependent children and both of them aged less than 65.
HH_09Other households without dependent children.
HH_10One adult with at least one dependent child.
HH_11Two adults with one dependent child.
HH_12Two adults with two dependent children.
HH_13Two adults with three or more dependent children.
HH_14Other households with dependent children.

cunits_hh

Consumption units: Modified OECD equivalence scale.

ydisp_hh

Household disposable income.

pov_hh

At risk of poverty indicator.

depriv_hh

Severe material deprivation indicator.

Source

Microdata at INE, the Spanish Statistical Office
